title: synchronym
author: synchronym
content: Bitcoin's popularity is increasing day by day. Now in today's society both men and women are working shoulder to shoulder together in the office. No exception to this, women are also very interested in Bitcoin and current Bitcoin. The reason for interest is that when a woman works in an office, it becomes a bit difficult for her to juggle family and children. In today's society we see many working women leave their children with the workers and go to office, those children are abused by the workers. I think all the sisters who have chosen this bitcoin as their profession should not face such problems. Because after all the children's work and household chores, there will be enough time to devote to bitcoins. So choosing Bitcoin as a career can be a good decision for girls.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Bitcoin is a decentralized cryptocurrency, NOT a career.What would help those with household responsibilities (regardless of gender) is remote work and flexible work hours.- Jay -

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: synchronym on June 12, 2023, 07:17:25 AMBitcoin's popularity is increasing day by day. Now in today's society both men and women are working shoulder to shoulder together in the office. No exception to this, women are also very interested in Bitcoin and current Bitcoin. The reason for interest is that when a woman works in an office, it becomes a bit difficult for her to juggle family and children. In today's society we see many working women leave their children with the workers and go to office, those children are abused by the workers. I think all the sisters who have chosen this bitcoin as their profession should not face such problems. Because after all the children's work and household chores, there will be enough time to devote to bitcoins. So choosing Bitcoin as a career can be a good decision for girls.As un_rank said, Bitcoin is absolutely not a career. In addition, in a sufficiently advanced and evolved world where people have access to Bitcoin - and therefore to the Internet - and where women work on an equal footing with men, this way of thinking makes no sense. Insofar as men could also be involved in raising children and maintaining the home, this is not an exclusively female problem. As un_rank said, flexible and remotely doable jobs could be a solution, as self-employment. But I don't see any link with BTC.This post doesn't make much sense in my humble opinion, Bitcoin is a decentralized currency, a great storage of value, but has nothing to do with the way people are working or not. Maybe for some traders, but we can't say this is a vast majority of us being professional traders.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Some people are truly misinterpreting Bitcoin: Bitcoin is not a job; it is a decentralized currency created to provide people with financial freedom.Although women are not exempt from Bitcoin if they have an interest in Bitcoin investment, taking it as a career is a bit inaccurate. I know that Bitcoin trading is a profession that one can take as a career, but it is not fully dependable due to the nature of the market, even though I know some people who are very professional and quit their job for Bitcoin investment.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: That's some very unnecessary gender-ism. Bitcoin is for whoever is interested in it — regardless of sex, age, jurisdiction, profession, how many dicks or nipples the person has, whatever. It's a neutral asset that doesn't give a crap who you are.

I mean yeah I get your point here since women can take care of their children at home and at the same time they can just do Bitcoin. Yeah, it was great but you're already assumed that all workers are abusive actually you could get a decent house worker to take care of your children with good pay they might taking good care of and needs of your children could lessen your load if your having difficulties with your child, Also when you buy or invest in Bitcoin you don't really need to work on it every day you could just buy Bitcoin and forget about it then occasionally just check the market It doesnt really need you to be on it 24/7 unless you want to do daily trading which is very stressful for women.You could easily solve this problem if the woman has a flexible job something like a work-from-home or remote job would work since they can take care of her children and at the same time do her job at home.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Quote from: un_rank on June 12, 2023, 07:36:16 AMBitcoin is a decentralized cryptocurrency, NOT a career.I guess they could still work for companies that pay their employees in bitcoin, companies like Stripe, exchanges etc.What’s not important though is gender in this, bitcoin is not better in any way for men or women. Bitcoin is for everybody, the only important thing is that you load up with as much as you can afford to.

comments.author: Vaskiy
comments.body: This is the wrong understanding about bitcoin. People should have the real understanding only then the true purpose for which Satoshi innovated bitcoin gets fulfilled. These days people keeps connecting bitcoin with each and everything just because it have got value as well multiple usage. Recently one have made a statement, bitcoin to demolish unemployment, now OP have mentioned it a career for women. Also I'm against the OP's statement that children left home and the housekeepers abuse the kids. This is happening somewhere, and for the same we shouldn't connect it commonly.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: *grabs a popcorn and see why this thread is considered to be sexist*Plus, any bitcoin or blockchain related job does not require penis nor vagina. As long as they are capable of doing their job properly and has interest to excel at these fields -- bitcoin does not care.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Quote from: synchronym on June 12, 2023, 07:17:25 AM Because after all the children's work and household chores, there will be enough time to devote to bitcoins. So choosing Bitcoin as a career can be a good decision for girls.Do you understand exactly what is Bitcoin and how it works? You are probably a victim of false info in the social or neighborhood for you to consider that Bitcoin is a career. Bitcoin can be use as payment for a job but Bitcoin itself doesn’t offer any job to woman unless he is a developer or a miner which is not advisable on your example since you are describing a house wife. Bitcoin is good for investment for house wife though since they will just need to hold and wait until their holdings is on profit. It’s not a career but a good investment opportunity for house wife.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: There seems to be confusion about what is Bitcoin and what is a career, as other posters have said Bitcoin is not a curry and its nature is not subjective. In other words there is no match at all between the work of a woman who is ultimately focused on Bitcoin. Bitcoin is not a company and not a subject to work with. Moreover, it has to do with gender, I think the placement is not quite right. But the point is the point that you want to convey, I know it's just that in this context it might be more of a side option for a woman to get to know Bitcoin better and be able to invest part of her finances in it.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: synchronym on June 12, 2023, 07:17:25 AMSo choosing Bitcoin as a career can be a good decision for girls.Bitcoin itself is Bitcoin and no career bonded with Bitcoin.If you want to have your career with Bitcoin, you have to do something with your bitcoin: trade it, invest with it, content writing, build your business with bitcoin and more activities which has bitcoin as one of your business components.Many jobs you can do with Bitcoin in cryptocurrency industry and they are open for men and women.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: And what happened to the OP's story, not everyone experiences it, and it all depends on who you place your child in, whether or not you know the person well as a whole.and bitcoin is not a career that has to be fought for like most people who will fight for their careers, and bitcoin also has risks that must be known and also don't have to be taken seriously because if you have to work at home, there are many other opportunities such as online business or other things that can done at home, in my opinion there are a lot of businesses like that and continue to grow according to technological developments.Bitcoins didn't become a regular or core income after the woman stopped working which was her regular income and also left her child with the wrong person. And if you do, it doesn't mean you have to focus on bitcoin because using bitcoin can be done while working or doing other things and makes bitcoin a promising side income if you do it for the long term. So bitcoin is not a career that should be taken seriously and only buy when the price goes down and hold it for the long term, and sell it back when the price goes up high. And keep working to make ends meet, working at home or substituting someone else to take care of it when going to work.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: DeathAngel on June 12, 2023, 08:31:53 AMQuote from: un_rank on June 12, 2023, 07:36:16 AMBitcoin is a decentralized cryptocurrency, NOT a career.I guess they could still work for companies that pay their employees in bitcoin, companies like Stripe, exchanges etc.What’s not important though is gender in this, bitcoin is not better in any way for men or women. Bitcoin is for everybody, the only important thing is that you load up with as much as you can afford to. It's true that Bitcoin enabled many sectors to work regardless the gender. But Bitcoin cannot be considered a career. Working on crypto exchanges or other remote companies is the same as working for other companies that accept workers to work remotely. Even if someone studies Bitcoin, analyzes the market all day, and makes money from trading. I would still say they build their career by studying Bitcoin. In this case, Trading is their career, not Bitcoin. Even if someone contributes to the Bitcoin development, I am unsure how they make money by helping implement new BIPs. I don't think developers get paid for their contributions. So, I am not sure if Bitcoin can be considered as a career!

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Women were not exempted from using bitcoin, i think this is a thing more of personal challenge that women do have a low priority take for than engaging in doing real time business due to their nature, we also cannot expect women have the same boldness as men do in dealing with a decentralized digital currency like bitcoin considering that it's also a volatile currency that can rise and fall at any time, the only few among women who can afford the ruggedness of risking their investment on this volatile currency were the few women found today as bitcoiners while a larger percentage may not afford coping with the use considering the time, task and risk.

comments.author: posi
comments.body: Bitcoin is not a career, and investing in bitcoin does not guarantee you a steady source of income. So, quitting your office job to invest in bitcoin and treating it like a main job is bad advice. Even if you earn high returns investing in bitcoin, never consider it your main job or source of income. Because its volatility does not guarantee you will always make money. Too many people are making basic but very serious mistakes about bitcoin. I have a feeling the younger generation now hardly wants to work but wants to make a lot of money, and they think bitcoin can meet that requirement.
